name: Expect.Extra
comment:
Extends Expect library with more `Expectation`s.

@docs contain, member

values.name: contain
values.comment:
Alias of `member`.

Reads better with bdd style tests.

    expect [0, 1, 2] to contain 1

    -- Passes because [0, 1, 2] contains 1

values.name: member
values.comment:
Passes if value is a member of list.

    member 1 [0, 1, 2]

    -- Passes because 1 is a member of [0, 1, 2]

name: Test.Extra
comment:
Write concise test for JSON decoders

@docs DecoderExpectation, describeDecoder, testDecoder

types.name: DecoderExpectation
types.comment:
Expectation for a decoder result.

* `FailsToDecode` - expect the decoder to fail, the failure message can be anything
* `FailsToDecodeWith String` - expect the decoder to fail with a specific message
* `DecodesTo a` - expect the decoder to succeed, decoding to the provided value

values.name: describeDecoder
values.comment:
Exercise a decoder over a list of input/expectation pairs.

For example

```elm
describeDecoder "int"
  Json.Decode.int
  [ ( "", FailsToDecode )
  , ( "foo", FailsToDecode )
  , ( "1", DecodesTo 1 )
  , ( "1.5", FailsToDecode )
  ]
```
values.type: String -> Json.Decode.Decoder a -> List ( String, Test.Extra.DecoderExpectation a ) -> Test.Test

values.name: testDecoder
values.comment:
Exercise a decoder with a JSON encoded string.

For example

```elm
testDecoder Json.Decode.string
  "\"foo\""
  (DecodesTo "foo")
```
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder a -> ( String, Test.Extra.DecoderExpectation a ) -> Test.Test
